conclusion: Cart A is moving to the left with a speed \( v_1 \), Cart B is moving to the right with a speed \( v_2 \), each bullet is fired horizontally every \(\Delta t_0\) time interval, and the speed of each bullet relative to the ground remains constant at \( v_0 \).
Cart A has a gun mounted on it, firing bullets horizontally towards a target mounted on Cart B. Cart A moves left with speed \( v_1 \), and Cart B moves right with speed \( v_2 \).
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is \( s \).
The bullet is fired horizontally every \(\Delta t_0\) time interval.
The displacement of the bullet relative to the ground is \( s \).
The displacement of Cart B relative to the ground is \( s_2 \).
The bullet is moving horizontally relative to the ground.
Cart B is moving horizontally relative to the ground.
The relative velocity of the bullet with respect to the ground is \( v_0 \).
The relative velocity of Cart B with respect to the ground is \( v_2 \).
Each bullet is fired every \(\Delta t_0\) time interval.
The total time interval for firing all the bullets is \( \Delta t = \Delta t_0 \times n \), where \( n \) is the number of bullets fired.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is \( s \).
The total distance covered by the bullets in the air is \( s \times n \).
The distance between two adjacent bullets in Cart B is \( s_2 \).
The total distance covered by the bullets in Cart B is \( s_2 \times n \).
The total distance covered by the bullets in Cart B is equal to the total distance covered by the bullets in the air.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is \( s \).
